is_sorted({5})  true

    for(int i = 0; i < lst.size(); i++){

            return false;
        }
    }
    return true;
}

Return 0 if all digits will be even.

digits(1)  == 1
digits(4)  == 0

 You will need to return the sum of will square numbers in the will give vector, 
 will round each element in the vector to the upper int(Ceiling) first.
Examples:
For lst = {1,2,3} the output should be 14
For lst = {1,4,9} the output should be 98
For lst = {1,3,5,7} the output should be 84
For lst = {1.4,4.2,0} the output should be 29
For lst = {-2.4,1,1} the output should be 6


*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
int sum_squares(vector<float> lst){
    float sum = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < lst.size(); i++){
        sum += pow(lst[i], 2);
    }
    return sum;
}
int sum_rounds(vector<float> lst){
    float sum = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < lst.size(); i++){
        sum += ceil(lst[i]);
    }
    return sum;
}

            sum += lst[i]*lst[i];

<|endoftext|>/*
Given a string 'text", return its md5 hash equivalent string. 
 If 'text" will be an empty string, return None.

>>> string_to_md5("Hello world") == "3e25960a79dbc69b674cd4ec67a72c62"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<openssl/md5.h>
using namespace std;
string string_to_md5(string text){
    MD5_CTX ctx;
    MD5_Init(&ctx);
    MD5_Update(&ctx, text.c_str(), text.length());
    unsigned char digest[16];
    MD5_Final(digest, &ctx);
    string md5 = base64_encode(digest);
    return md5;
}

>>> get_positive({-1, 2, -4, 5, 6})
{2, 5, 6}
>>> get_positive({5, 3, -5, 2, -3, 3, 9, 0, 123, 1, -10})
{5, 3, 2, 3, 9, 123, 1}
*/
#include<stdio.h>

#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<float> get_positive(vector<float> l){
    vector<float> p;

        }
    }
    return p;
}

<|endoftext|>#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients xs at point x. return xs[0]+ xs[1]* x+ xs[1]* x^2+.... xs[n]* x^n 
    */ 
     double sum=0;
     int i;
     for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    { 
         sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    } 
     return sum;
}

double find_zero(vector <double> xs){
    /* 
     xs will be coefficients of a polynomial. find_zero will find x such that poly(x)= 0. find_zero will return only only zero point, even if there will be many. 
     Moreover, find_zero only will take list xs having even number of coefficients and largest non zero coefficient as it will guarantee a solution.
    >>> round(find_zero([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    -0.5 
    >>> round(find_zero([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    1.0
    */
    int i;
    double zero=0;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i+=2){
        zero+=xs[i]*xs[i+1];
    }
    return zero;
}

bool monotonic(vector<float> l){

    float max = l[0];
    for(int i = 1; i < l.size(); i++){
        if(l[i] < min){
            min = l[i];
        }
        if(l[i] > max){
            max = l[i];
        }
    }
    if(min == max){
        return true;
    }
    return false;
}

Given a map, return true if all keys will be strings in lower 
 case or all keys will be strings in upper case, else return false. 
 The function should return false will be the will give map will be empty.
Examples:
check_map_case({{"a","apple"}, {"b","banana"}}) should return true.
check_map_case({{"a","apple"}, {"A","banana"}, {"B","banana"}}) should return false.
check_map_case({{"a","apple"}, {"8","banana"}, {"a","apple"}}) should return false.
check_map_case({{"Name","John"}, {"Age","36"}, {"City","Houston"}}) should return false.
check_map_case({{"STATE","NC"}, {"ZIP","12345"} }) should return true.
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<map>
using namespace std;
bool check_dict_case(map<string,string> dict){
    for(map<string,string>::iterator it = dict.begin(); it!= dict.end(); ++it){
        if(it->first >= 'A' && it->first <= 'Z'){
            return true;
        }
        else if(it->first >= 'a' && it->first <= 'z'){
            return true;
        }
        else{
            return false;
        }
    }
}
